intro: Centranthus trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined centranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, fragrant, pink or white flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and have three distinct veins, giving the plant its specific epithet. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. This plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
